School Name: The CS and DS Summer School
Course Name: Big Data Handling with Excel & SQL
Desc_short: Dive into the world of data analysis using the most accessible tools out there. Whether you're a beginner or just looking to brush up your skills, this course takes you through Excel and SQL with bite-sized videos, practical assignments, designed to fit into your daily routine.
Desc:
This course is designed to give students hands-on exposure to Excel and SQL, focusing on practical data analysis and real-world business use-cases. Through a curated set of short, beginner-friendly videos, you'll learn everything from spreadsheet fundamentals to pivot tables and conditional logic functions.

We emphasize clarity, simplicity, and accessibility. No prior experience is needed. Each video covers a specific feature, allowing you to steadily build your skills.

The course also includes assignments to reinforce your learning and help you develop fluency in tools that are widely used across industries today. You’ll also gain insight into how these tools compare with other modern alternatives and understand where they stand amidst today’s AI and automation wave.
Evaluation:
Evaluative metric & Certification criteria [Excel] : 
5 assignments will be given, out of which any 3 are compulsory
The final project for Excel is compulsory

Evaluative metric & Certification criteria [SQL]
2 assignments will be given, any one of of them is compulsory
Final project is compulsory
Certification: 3/5 assignments of Excel, 1/2 assignments of SQL and Final project
Week 1:
Excel:
- Introduction to spreadsheets
- Basics of spreadsheets
- Columns, row and cell formatting
- Basics of formulas
- Introduction to functions
- Absolute and Relative referencing
- Introduction to data quality & importing file data
- Data cleaning techniques
Week 2:
Excel:
- Sorting & Filtering
- Some important functions
- VLOOKUP & HLOOKUP functions
- Pivot Tables
SQL:
- Installation and setup
- Introduction
- Queries in SQL
- Functions in SQL
- Operators in SQL
Week 3:
Excel:
- All about Charts
- Dashboarding
SQL:
- All about clauses
- SQL Joins
- Subquery in SQL
Week 4: 1 project each for Excel and SQL

School Name: The CS and DS Summer School
Desc_short: Kickstart your data science journey with our beginner-friendly "Data Science Fundamentals with Python" course! Start from core Python skills, explore data handling and data visualization with exciting libraries transitioning to ML through supervised and unsupervised learning algorithms with in-depth yet carefully curated easy-to-follow resources finishing off with a perfect real world project to reinforce key concepts while building your portfolio. This isn’t just a course; it’s your gateway to mastering the transformation of Basic raw data into Brilliant actionable intelligence!
Desc:
Step into one of the hottest career paths of the 21st century with this comprehensive four week course by the Analytics Club in Python for Data Science and Machine Learning as a part of Learner’s Space. Whether you're a curious student or a tech explorer leveling up your skill set, this course is your launchpad. We’ve packed it with in-depth yet carefully curated resources. From writing your first line of Python to building models that can actually think, you’ll learn to clean, analyze, and predict like a pro.

The course ends with a perfect bridge between theory and practical expertise. The Capstone Project is the culmination of your learning journey, where you apply supervised and unsupervised techniques to a real-world dataset-just like a professional data scientist. This hands-on experience reinforces key concepts, builds your portfolio, and boosts confidence in solving complex problems.

No prior experience is needed - just curiosity and commitment. Start from scratch, finish with real skills.
Evaluation: There will be 3 worksheets and 1 final capstone project
Certification: 1st Phase worksheet, Atleast one among the 2nd and 3rd Phase worksheets and Capstone project are necessary for certification
Week 1:
Python Modules


Python Basics: Learn the building blocks of Python: variables, control flow, functions, and more.
Jupyter Notebooks: Explore the interactive coding environment used by data scientists.
Numpy: Learn about dealing with arrays and vectorized computations in python.
Pandas: Dive into data manipulation with powerful tools for cleaning, filtering, and transforming datasets.
Matplotlib: Create basic plots and visualizations to understand data trends and patterns.
Seaborn: Build beautiful, statistical visualizations of data.
Worksheet 1 – Apply your skills through hands-on coding exercises.
Week 2:
Supervised Learning - Regression

Domains of Analytics: Understand how data science, data analytics, and machine learning differ - and where they overlap.
Scikit-Learn Essentials: Get hands-on with the most popular ML library for Python.
Linear Regression: Explore the fundamentals of modeling straight-line relationships in data.
Multiple Linear Regression: Go beyond one feature and learn how to model with multiple predictors.
Time Series Analysis: Understand time-dependent data and recognize temporal patterns.
Time Series Forecasting: Explore statistical models such as ARMA to predict future trends.
Anomaly detection: Discover how to spot unusual or unexpected behavior in time series data.
Worksheet 2: Apply your learned skills through coding exercises and problems.
Week 3:
Supervised Learning - Classification
Regression vs Classification: Learn the key differences between predicting numbers and predicting categories.
Logistic Regression: Model binary probabilities using this basic classification algorithm.
Decision Trees & Random Forests: Learn about tree-based models that mimic human decision making.
Optional Classification algorithms: Understand additional classification algorithms such as Support Vector Machines and K-Nearest Neighbors.
Neural Networks – Delve into deep learning with one of the most powerful ML tools.
Probability distributions and Central Limit Theorem: Learn about statistics and data behavior through Gaussian, Bernoulli, and Exponential distributions.
Worksheet 3: Get hands-on experience with code implementation of ML algorithms.
Week 4:
Unsupervised Learning

Intro to Unsupervised Learning: Discover how machines find hidden patterns without labeled data or guidance.
K-Means Clustering: Group similar data points into clusters based on distance.
Hierarchical Clustering: Build tree-like cluster structures to explore nested relationships in data.
Gaussian Mixture Models: Use probability-based clustering to model data that doesn’t fit into neat boundaries.
Dimensionality Reduction: Simplify complex datasets using techniques such as Principal Component Analysis, Singular Value Decomposition and Linear Discriminant Analysis.
Matrix Factorization: Learn about the core technique behind recommendation systems.
Capstone Project: Test your skills with a hands-on project encompassing the entire course content.

Desc_short: This lecture series by Team SHUNYA introduces students to the fundamentals of sustainable building design. Through interactive sessions, real-world case studies, and expert insights, participants will explore energy-efficient strategies, eco-friendly materials, and climate-responsive architecture. Whether you're an aspiring architect, engineer, or sustainability enthusiast, this series will equip you with the knowledge and inspiration to design for a greener future.
Desc:
This lecture series offers a comprehensive introduction to the principles and practices of sustainable building design, tailored for students from diverse academic backgrounds. 

Participants will gain insights into:

-Sustainable architecture and climate-responsive design
-Energy-efficient systems (passive and active strategies)
-Green building materials and construction techniques
-Net-zero energy and carbon-neutral buildings
-Simulation tools and performance evaluation
-Policy, certification, and global sustainability standards (e.g., GRIHA, LEED)

The series will also highlight key innovations and learnings from Team SHUNYA’s real-world project Vivaan, standing on the campus opposite hostel 6 including their Solar Decathlon-winning projects.

By the end of the course, students will be equipped with foundational knowledge to approach building design from an environmental, economic, and human-centric perspective—empowering them to contribute meaningfully to a sustainable built environment.
Week 1:
Foundations of Sustainable Design

Objectives:
Learn the basics of sustainable building design.
Understand how buildings impact the environment.
Discover the importance of energy efficiency and passive design.

Activities:
Introductory lecture
Case studies of green buildings
Interactive quiz or discussion
Week 2:
Materials, Technologies & Real-World Examples

Objectives:
Explore eco-friendly materials and technologies.
See real-world examples of sustainable buildings.
Discover smart design strategies for energy savings.

Activities:
Case studies of green buildings
Group activity: Design a basic sustainable layout
Week 3:
Life Cycle Assessment (LCA)

Objectives:
 Understand the concept of Life Cycle Assessment in buildings.
 Learn to evaluate environmental impact from material to demolition.
 Explore tools and techniques used in LCA.

Activities:
Lecture on LCA basics
Software or manual LCA walkthrough
Group activity: Conduct a simplified LCA on a sample building component

School Name: The Management Summer School (Courses in Consult, Finance, Entrepreneurship, Economics*)
Desc_short: Unlock the secrets of smart money management and investment strategies. Build confidence in navigating personal finance, market dynamics and stock valuation. Gain practical tools to make informed financial decisions and take control of your financial future.
Desc:
Fundamentals of Finance will introduce you to the essential concepts of financial literacy in a clear and practical manner. You will begin with personal money management topics such as budgeting, saving, and investing, before progressing to the effects of macroeconomic factors like GDP, inflation, and interest rates on markets.
Delve into various asset classes like equities, debt, real estate, and commodities while learning how to create a diversified investment portfolio tailored to your financial goals and risk tolerance. You'll also enhance your ability to perform fundamental analysis, equipping you with the tools to read financial statements and spot investment prospects.
Through interactive speaker sessions and hands-on assignments, you will acquire real-world insights and practical strategies to confidently manage your finances and investments. Join us to take control of your financial future!
Week_time: 3 hours of work per week, plus 1 additional hour for speaker sessions
Evaluation:
There will be 4 assignments, one assignment per week, based on the content covered.
Each assignment contributes equally to the overall assessment.
Certification: Successful completion of 3/4 assignments without any plagiarism or use of AI tools like ChatGPT, Gemini etc. and attendance in 3/4 speaker sessions
Week 1:
Personal Finance:
Learn the essentials of managing money, including budgeting, saving, investing, and building an emergency fund. Understand stock market basics, the importance of diversification, and how to avoid common mistakes. Develop a mindset for long-term financial growth with simple, actionable steps.
Week 2:
Macroeconomics and Market Functioning:
Understand key economic indicators like GDP, inflation, interest rates, and unemployment, and how they impact markets and investments. Learn the basics of fiscal policy and government spending, and explore market cycles and economic trends affecting stocks, bonds, and personal finance.
Week 3:
Asset Classes:
Get an overview of key asset types—equity, debt, real estate, and commodities. Learn about their risk, liquidity, and role in income generation and portfolio diversification. Understand how investors allocate assets based on risk tolerance and financial goals.
Week 4:
Fundamental Analysis:
Learn to read financial statements and key ratios. Understand how to interpret earnings reports and connect financial data to stock valuation, helping you identify undervalued or overvalued stocks.

Course Name: DIVING DEEP INTO CHEMICAL INDUSTRY: CONQUERING THE TECHNO-COMERCIAL ASPECTS
Desc_short:
This isn’t your typical classroom theory—learn how the chemical industry really works.
From reactors and green tech to pricing strategies and investment decisions,
we blend engineering brilliance with business brains.
Explore how shampoos, fuels, and pharmaceuticals are made—and sold.
Decode global market trends, sustainability moves, and innovation strategies.
Want to build, lead, or disrupt in chemicals?
This is your launchpad.
Think beyond labs. Think impact.
Join us and conquer the techno-commercial world of chemicals!
Desc:
Ever wondered what powers the $5-trillion global chemical industry behind your shampoo, your phone, and even the fuel in your car? This summer, we’re not just talking reactions—we’re decoding the real-world engine of the chemical world.

“Diving Deep into Chemical Industry: Conquering the Techno-Commercial Aspects” is your gateway to understanding not just how chemicals are made, but how the industry makes money, impacts lives, and drives innovation. Across four immersive modules, this course bridges hard-core engineering with sharp business insight—arming you with the skills every chemical industry leader needs.

You'll explore:

The evolution, trends, and global scope of the chemical industry.

The engineering backbone—process design, kinetics, catalysis, separation, and modern technologies like green chemistry.

The markets—understand how chemicals fuel everything from pharmaceuticals to energy, and how demand shapes production.

The business—costs, pricing, investments, R&D, and real-world decisions chemical companies face daily.

Whether you're curious about how your classroom concepts apply to billion-dollar industries, or you dream of running your own chemical venture someday, this course will fuel your ambition and give you clarity on where your passion can lead.
Evaluation: Total of four modules, each will have its own quiz of 10 marks approx and last final report of 60 marks.
Certification: to clear the course passing criteria is 60% of total
Week 1:
Introduction to the Chemical Industry
Uncover the evolution and scope of the chemical industry—from ancient alchemy to global powerhouses.
Understand where India stands and where the world is heading.
Get introduced to techno-commercial thinking that drives real-world decision-making.
Week 2:
Chemical Processes and Technologies
Go inside the heart of production—mass balances, reactors, catalysis, and separations.
Explore how processes are optimized for efficiency, sustainability, and scale.
Discover how modern tools like green chemistry and simulation shape the future.
Week 3:
Chemical Products and Markets
Learn what the world demands—specialty chemicals, pharma, petrochemicals, and more.
See how chemicals power industries like agriculture, construction, and electronics.
Understand market trends, demand drivers, and the booming Indian chemical scene.
Week 4:
Chemical Economics & Management
Get into the business side—costing, pricing, profitability, and investments.
Tackle real-world challenges like supply chains, quality, and safety.
See how innovation and R&D fuel billion-dollar decisions in the chemical world.

School Name: The Science Summer School (Pure Sciences like Maths, Biology, Physics, Chemistry, Economics*)
Course Name: Computational Soft and Active Matter: Modeling Self-Organisation and Collective Behavior
Desc_short: From particles to patterns—simulate how flocks form, clusters jam, and agents organise in motion! Build your own soft and active matter simulations from scratch
Desc:
This course offers an  introduction to computational modeling of soft and active matter systems, where students explore how complex collective behaviors emerge from simple rules. Over four weeks, learners will build interactive simulations using Python to investigate phenomena like clustering, jamming, and flocking.

Week 1 introduces particle dynamics and repulsive forces in soft matter systems.

Week 2 explores inter-particle potentials and self-organization, modeling systems like foams and colloids.

Week 3 dives into active matter, implementing the Vicsek model to simulate flocking and noise-driven phase transitions.

Week 4 brings it all together in a capstone-style project, modeling flocking agents navigating through obstacles using alignment, repulsion, and self-propulsion.

Students will use Python and libraries like numpy and matplotlib to visualize behaviours in real time. 

By the end of the course, learners will have built their own simulation engines, developed insights into self-organization, and created a final project showcasing their understanding of soft and active matter systems.
Evaluation:
Attendance: 75% required
Weekly Assignments (60%)
Capstone Project (40%)
Passing Criteria: Minimum 50% overall to pass
Certification: 75% attendance, out of 3 assignments one can be left, capstone project is must and 50% grades in assignments depending on code quality
Pre-req: Some experience with Python (especially numpy and matplotlib)
Week 1:
Integration methods: Euler, Velocity Verlet
Soft repulsion using Lennard-Jones-like potential
Boundary handling: reflective and periodic
Energy conservation basics
Week 2:
Clustering, aggregation, jamming phenomena
Attractive-repulsive potentials (modified Lennard-Jones)
Spatial metrics: pairwise distances, cluster sizes
Concepts of equilibrium vs non-equilibrium systems
Week 3:
Vicsek model: self-propulsion + local alignment + noise
Ordered vs disordered states
Order parameter 
Influence of noise and density
Week 4:
Coupling Vicsek model with soft repulsion
Adding static obstacles as repelling objects
Measuring density, energy, order
